description: Change of use of a vacant medical centre (Use Class D1) to 43 room house in multiple occupation, alterations to fenestration and the provision of 2 disabled car parking spaces, bicycle store (18 spaces), refuse and recycling store and amenity space
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s)  002 Rev C, 100 Rev F, 101 Rev E, 102 Rev E, 103 Rev E, 104 Rev D, 105 Rev D unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Refuse storage shall be provided in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the commencement of the development and retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2011) policy 5.16. | A minimum of eighteen (18) cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan 2011. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.  Reason:	To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Core Strategy and policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011. | No part of the second floor level terrace/access area shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | The maximum number of persons occupying the house in multiple occupation (including any live-in managers) hereby approved shall be limited to no more than forty eight persons.  Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of the occupiers, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013 and policies 3.3 and 3.5 of the London Plan 2011. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details in line with the criteria specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, including, as appropriate, the noise exposure category, the BS4142 rating noise and the predicted vibration levels.  The details shall also include the noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided and also mitigation of vibration.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that the proposed external lighting scheme will comply with the advice given at BS 5389 Part 9, with regards to upward light and light pollution and lighting of public amenity areas and ILE guidance on Reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2005.  Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | CCTV and lighting shall be installed to monitor activity along the access to the property between Gunnersbury Lane and the front access door to the building. This CCTV shall be monitored by the on-site concierge and both the CCTV and lighting shall be maintained at all times.   Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder and to improve pedestrian accessibility in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2011). | Landscaping shall be provided on site in accordance with Drawing Number 002 Revision C. A landscaping buffer between the proposed car parking spaces and the building in the form of a hedge shall be provided and maintained on site at all times.    Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of the occupiers, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013 and policies 3.3 and 3.5 of the London Plan 2011.
